intro: Itea homalioidea, commonly known as the white beakweed, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It is a member of the Hydrangeaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and have a finely toothed margin, while its stems are often reddish in color. Itea homalioidea is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and blooms.
